articles.title: You can join the queue to buy a PlayStation 5 right now

articles.description:
An excellent budget phone without the hassle of buying from a carrier | Photo by Allison Johnson / The Verge
    

  
One of the year‚Äôs best budget phones is finally available unlocked in the US. The OnePlus Nord N20 5G launched as a T-Mobile exclusive in April, and that was the only way to get ahold of one ‚Äî until now. The N20 5G is now up for sale from Amazon, Best Buy, or directly from OnePlus for $299 with 6GB of RAM and 128GB of storage.
Take note that the unlocked N20 won‚Äôt work on Verizon ‚Äî not on 5G or 4G. AT&T customers will be able to connect to 4G only, which isn‚Äôt too bad of a deal given that the carrier is taking a slower approach to expanding its more meaningful mid-band 5G coverage. T-Mobile subscribers will, of course, get 5G and 4G coverage. 
This makes the unlocked N20 best suited to AT&T customers who don‚Äôt need 5G or someone on a...
Continue reading‚Ä¶

articles.description:
Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge
    

  
Apple‚Äôs new 13-inch MacBook Pro M2 base model appears to have slower SSD speeds than its M1 predecessor. MacRumors reports that YouTubers Max Tech and Created Tech have both tested the 256GB base M2 model and discovered the SSD‚Äôs read speeds are around 50 precent slower than the M1 MacBook Pro with 256GB of storage. Write speeds are reportedly around 30 percent slower.
Testing was completed using Blackmagic‚Äôs Disk Speed Test app, and Max Tech even disassembled the 13-inch M2 MacBook Pro and found that Apple is only using a single NAND flash storage chip. The M1 MacBook Pro uses two 128GB NAND chips, and multiple chips can enable faster SSD speeds in parallel.


Other 13-inch M2 MacBook Pro models with larger SSD storage don‚Äôt appear to...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Apple‚Äôs entry-level MacBook Pro M2 has slower SSD speeds than its M1 counterpart

articles.description:
Photo by Chris Welch / The Verge
    

  
Facebook‚Äôs app for smart TVs, which lets users tune into various videos, shows, and livestreams on the platform, may no longer be available on Apple TV, as first reported by 9to5Mac. Some users say they‚Äôre no longer able to access the app after its most recent update.
In a thread on MacRumors, one user shares an image of the notice they received after attempting to open Facebook Watch on their Apple TV 4K: ‚ÄúThe Facebook Watch TV app is no longer available, but you can still find lots of videos on Facebook at www.facebook.com/watch.‚Äù Several other users report having the same experience.
Facebook rolled out its Watch app on Apple TV in 2017 after first launching it on Samsung smart TVs. The app is also available on various other smart TVs...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Facebook‚Äôs video app may no longer work on Apple TV

articles.description:
Image: Riot Games
    

  
Riot Games, the developer behind the free first-person shooter (FPS) Valorant, will start monitoring players‚Äô voice communications on July 13th (via PCGamer). The game company says it‚Äôs to help train the language models that it will eventually use when evaluating player reports across all its games.
Riot initially announced this change in April 2021 after making an update to its privacy policy. The new terms give Riot permission to ‚Äúrecord and potentially evaluate voice data when using Riot-owned voice comms channels‚Äù with the purpose of combatting hate speech and harassment over voice chat. Riot says it will analyze recordings when a player reports someone for abusive or offensive comments. In turn, this should help the company...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Valorant will start monitoring your voice chats starting July 13th

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
Apple‚Äôs poised to release a slew of new devices between this fall and the beginning of 2023, according to a report from Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman. What Gurman describes as a ‚Äúdeluge‚Äù of products will reportedly include four iPhone 14 devices, a set of new iPads, three Apple Watches, several M2 / M3-upgraded Macs, a pair of refreshed AirPods Pro buds, a new HomePod, and a spec-boosted Apple TV model.
Let‚Äôs break down these predictions. 
Although Apple announced two new Macs with its flagship M2 processor at its Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) earlier this month, Gurman expects to find the chip ‚Äî and its variations ‚Äî in several other devices. This includes an M2 Mac mini, M2 Pro Mac mini, M2 Pro / M2 Max 14 and 16-inch MacBook Pros,...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Report: Apple is gearing up to launch a ‚Äòflood‚Äô of new devices starting this fall

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
Apple‚Äôs mixed reality headset has been shrouded in rumors for months now, and a new report from Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman indicates that it could come with Apple‚Äôs flagship M2 processor. According to Gurman, Apple‚Äôs most recent version of the device, which is reportedly capable of delivering augmented reality (AR) and virtual reality (VR) experiences,  includes a base M2 chip and 16GB of RAM.
This deviates from supply chain analyst Ming-Chi Kuo‚Äôs previous prediction that Apple‚Äôs headset will have one processor with the capabilities of an M1 chip and an additional lower-end processor dedicated to handling data from the device‚Äôs sensors. While Gurman doesn‚Äôt mention the purported secondary chip in this report, a multiple chip setup has also...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Apple‚Äôs mixed reality headset will reportedly come with an M2 chip

articles.description:
Check out that wear and tear. | Image: Andrew Webster
    

  
Back in November 2009, I was getting ready to attend the Montreal International Games Summit, and I panicked ‚Äî it was my first major event as a member of the press, and I had no way to record an interview. This was a problem because I was scheduled to talk with Yoichi Wada, then president of Square Enix, along with several other notable industry people. So I rushed to Radio Shack and picked the cheapest voice recorder I could find, a little grey rectangle made by RCA that was locked up in a glass display case. I have no idea what model it is, but it went on to follow me through my entire professional career to date ‚Äî now, nearly 13 years later, it‚Äôs finally being retired.
I hung on to that gadget for one main reason: I trusted it. The...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: This 13-year-old voice recorder captured my entire professional career

articles.description:
Photo by Bryan Bedder/Getty Images for Spritz Society
    

  
Spotify has a brand new original topping its podcast chart, but it would probably prefer if you didn‚Äôt know about it. 
Last week, Spotify launched a new pop culture show, Breaking Bread, on Spotify Live. Breaking Bread‚Äôs recordings now rank at number 11 on Spotify‚Äôs top podcast chart after holding the number two spot for most of the week, putting it just behind Joe Rogan. The show‚Äôs popularity ‚Äî and the reason the company might be staying quiet about its new hit ‚Äî is due to its two hosts: Jackie Oshry Weinreb and Claudia Oshry (aka Instagram‚Äôs girlwithnojob), who come with a huge built-in audience. While the sisters have delivered their massive fanbase to the app, they have a controversial history that could be problematic for Spotify at...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Spotify secretly launched a show with this controversial duo ‚Äî it‚Äôs already a hit

articles.description:
It took a while.
    

  
My review of the M2 MacBook Pro went up last Wednesday. But as soon as I got my hands on the device on the prior Thursday, it was clear that running down the battery ‚Äî one of the most important things a laptop reviewer needs to do ‚Äî was going to be a Whole Thing. 
Reader, I tried. I would use the device all evening and leave it running all night, but it would still have plenty of charge left in the morning, and I‚Äôd have to plug it in for testing, abandon it to film, or give it to our video and photo teams for shooting before I could fully drain it down. I did not have a long enough interrupted span of time to continuously use the device. That‚Äôs how absurdly long this laptop lasts. 
But, with the written review and the video review both...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: My journey to drain the M2 MacBook Pro‚Äôs battery

articles.description:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
    

  
A sophisticated spyware campaign is getting the help of internet service providers (ISPs) to trick users into downloading malicious apps, according to research published by Google‚Äôs Threat Analysis Group (TAG) (via TechCrunch). This corroborates earlier findings from security research group Lookout, which has linked the spyware, dubbed Hermit, to Italian spyware vendor RCS Labs.
Lookout says RCS Labs is in the same line of work as NSO Group ‚Äî the infamous surveillance-for-hire company behind the Pegasus spyware ‚Äî and peddles commercial spyware to various government agencies. Researchers at Lookout believe Hermit has already been deployed by the government of Kazakhstan and Italian authorities. In line with these findings, Google has...
Continue reading‚Ä¶
articles.title: Google says attackers worked with ISPs to deploy Hermit spyware on Android and iOS

articles.title: The Capstone Launch Will Kick Off NASA‚Äôs Artemis Moon Program

articles.author: Maggie Chen
articles.description: Two new studies use whole genome sequencing to explore how the animals have fared in warmer conditions, raising questions about climate and adaptation.
articles.title: What Polar Bear Genomes May Reveal About Life in a Low-Ice Arctic

articles.author: Matt Reynolds, Morgan Meaker
articles.description: In the pandemic‚Äôs early days, government-backed public health apps acquired millions of users‚Äîa ready-made audience developers are eager to tap.
articles.title: How Covid Tracking Apps Are Pivoting for Commercial Profit

articles.author: Rachael Pells
articles.description: Genomic analysis of ancient remains has shed light on the origins of the black death and offers insights into the coevolution of humans and diseases.
articles.title: What the DNA of Ancient Humans Reveals About Pandemics

articles.author: Lily Hay Newman
articles.description: Starting with iOS 16, people who are at risk of being targeted with spyware will have some much-needed help.
articles.title: Apple‚Äôs Lockdown Mode Aims to Counter Spyware Threats

articles.author: Matt Burgess
articles.description: Fake sellers. Competitions. Crypto cons. There are plenty of grifts on the platform, but you don‚Äôt have to get sucked in.
articles.title: How to Avoid the Worst Instagram Scams

articles.author: Lily Hay Newman
articles.description: With abortion set to be criminalized in more than half the US, encryption has never been more important for protection‚Äîand civil disobedience.
articles.title: End-to-End Encryption's Central Role in Modern Self-Defense

articles.author: Lily Hay Newman
articles.description: From cryptocurrency thefts to intrusions into telecom giants, state-backed attackers have had a field day in the year‚Äôs first half.
articles.title: The Worst Hacks and Breaches of 2022 So Far

articles.author: Matt Burgess
articles.description: Plus: Indian hacker-for-hire groups, Chinese student espionage efforts, and more.
articles.title: Gun Database Breach Leaks Details on Thousands of Owners

articles.author: Justin Ling
articles.description: Putting sensor-packed Chinese cars on Western roads could be a privacy issue. Just ask Tesla.
articles.title: Is Your New Car a Threat to National Security?

articles.author: Dan Goodin, Ars Technica
articles.description: Researchers say the remote-access Trojan ZuoRAT is likely the work of a nation-state and has infected at least 80 different targets.
articles.title: A New, Remarkably Sophisticated Malware Is Attacking Routers

articles.author: Kate O'Flaherty
articles.description: Plus: Google issues fixes for Android bugs. And Cisco, Citrix, SAP, WordPress, and more issue major patches for enterprise systems.
articles.title: You Need to Update Windows and Chrome Right Now

articles.author: Chris Stokel-Walker
articles.description: A German ad-tech trial features what Vodafone calls ‚Äúdigital tokens.‚Äù Should you be worried?
articles.title: ‚ÄòSupercookies‚Äô Have Privacy Experts Sounding the Alarm

articles.author: Reece Rogers
articles.description: If you use a mix of Apple, Android, and Windows gadgets, you're in luck: The security tool is now available to any Microsoft 365 subscriber.
articles.title: How to Use Microsoft Defender on All Your Devices

articles.author: Andrew Couts
articles.description: Plus: Microsoft details Russia‚Äôs Ukraine hacking campaign, Meta‚Äôs election integrity efforts dwindle, and more.
articles.title: The Post-Roe Privacy Nightmare Has Arrived

articles.author: Matt Burgess
articles.description: It's never been easier to switch between iPhone and Android‚Äîand to get your messages out of the Meta ecosystem entirely.
articles.title: How to Move Your WhatsApp Chats Across Devices and Apps

articles.author: Lily Hay Newman
articles.description: The spyware has been used to target people in Italy, Kazakhstan, and Syria, researchers at Google and Lookout have found.
articles.title: Google Warns of New Spyware Targeting iOS and Android Users

articles.author: Alexis Hancock
articles.description: After months of digging into privacy and security issues around these apps, I have some serious concerns.
articles.title: Parents Need to Know What‚Äôs Going On Inside Their Day Care Apps

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
In one of his most ambitious bodies of work to date, artist Collin van der Sluijs (previously) references two forces being incidentally forced together. ‚ÄúThese strange times have caused a collision between me as a person and my work,‚Äù he shares, ‚ÄúI want to be free and not a puppet on strings directed by anybody.‚Äù
This sentiment pervades the Dutch artist‚Äôs latest collection opening this week at both Vertical Gallery and Vertical Project Space in Chicago. More
articles.title: A New Collection of Works by Collin van der Sluijs Channels a Dreamlike Collision of Emotion

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Whether in the form of nebulae or starry galactic expanses, natural light continues to dominate Royal Museums Greenwich‚Äôs Astronomy Photographer of the Year competition (previously). The 14th annual contest garnered more than 3,000 submissions from 67 countries, and a shortlist of finalists contains stunning shots of a September harvest moon illuminating Glastonbury Tor, the brilliant streaks trailing Comet Leonard, and the vibrant Aurora Borealis casting an ominous glow above a battered ship in Westfjords. More
articles.title: Brilliant Phenomena and Galactic Skies Light Up the 2022 Astronomy Photographer of the Year Shortlist

articles.author: Kate Mothes
articles.description: Boxing gloves typically evoke associations with masculinity, competition, and aggression, but Zo√´ Buckman punches back with her series of mixed-media sculptures and embroidered textile pieces. Sometimes draped like bunches of dried flowers and other times balanced delicately on top of one another, they ‚Äúquestion whether they are holding each other up or tearing each other down,‚Äù says a statement. Taking a feminist and activist approach to challenging preconceptions about gender, trauma, and safety, she became interested in the symbolic dualities of the gloves, both in the way they are made and used. More
articles.title: Vintage Textiles and Boxing Gloves Redefine Strength and Vulnerability in Sculptures by Zo√´ Buckman

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Disposable coffee cups are undeniably damaging to the planet and its inhabitants, and even as some regions ban them entirely, we‚Äôll continue to feel the effects of our consumption for generations. The estimated 250 billion vessels we collectively use each year often wind up in landfills and oceans contributing to pollution, although they aren‚Äôt the only harmful component of our morning habits: The grounds also produce gasses and damage soils when discarded in large quantities, two problems the designers behind the innovative Kreis Cup want to remedy. More
articles.title: Coffee Grounds Live a Second Life as Reusable Mugs That Circumvent Single-Use Plastics

articles.author: Colossal
articles.description:
Every month, Colossal shares a selection of opportunities for artists and designers, including open calls, grants, fellowships, and residencies. If you‚Äôd like to list an opportunity here, please get in touch at hello@colossal.art. You can also join our monthly Opportunities Newsletter.
¬†
Open Calls
The 13th Epson International Pano Awards
More
articles.title: July 2022 Opportunities: Open Calls, Residencies, and Grants for Artists

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Armed with his Leica and an extraordinary amount of patience, Matt Stuart ventures through the streets of cities worldwide to capture the unexpected and coincidental moments of everyday life. His practice revolves around finding humor, play, and serendipity in the mundane, a skill he‚Äôs cultivated throughout his 25-year career and recounts in the recently released volume Think Like a Street Photographer.
Published by Laurence King, the book pairs 100 of Stuart‚Äôs images with detailed descriptions of his process. More
articles.title: Street Photographer Matt Stuart‚Äôs Incredibly Serendipitous Images Collected in a New Book

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Hungary-based artist Fanni Sandor (previously) expands her already minuscule menagerie with even tinier creatures. Using polymer clay, feathers, fur, and other materials, Sandor sculpts biologically accurate miniatures at a 1:12 scale, and many of her recent pieces include newborns and adolescents: a trio of joeys cling to their mother‚Äôs back, a chick slurps a worm, and a duckling grasps a monarch in its bill. Sandor shares more of the adorable animals and information on which are available on Instagram. More
articles.title: Turtles, Ducklings, and Pheasants Comprise an Adorable Menagerie of Miniatures by Fanni Sandor

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Elaborately configured grids and systems capitalize on the immense power of neodymium magnets to visualize the invisible. A new collaborative video from Magnet Tricks and Magnetic Games demonstrates how shifting a single element can set an entire design in motion, prompting each component to shake and vibrate in response. A visually mesmerizing example of basic physics, the project is also a study of sound and its manipulable patterns, so make sure you turn your volume up. More
articles.title: Invisible Forces Vibrate and Quiver within Elaborately Constructed Fields of Magnets

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Japanese artist and designer Mariko Kusumoto (previously) shapes gossamer coral and sea creatures from soft fibers like polyester, nylon, and cotton. Embedded with tiny ripples or airy pockets, the standalone sculptures and wearables are translucent renditions of lifeforms, and their delicate compositions correspond with the fragility of the subject matter. The Boston-based artist tends to cluster the individual pieces into larger works, creating sprawling reefs and diverse ecosystems brimming with color and texture. More
articles.title: Clusters of Diaphanous Textile Sculptures by Mariko Kusumoto Evoke the Ocean Floor

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: San Jose-based artist Sam Rodriguez might liken an abstract leaf sprouting from a young woman‚Äôs garment or a Pac-Man-esque rendering floating near a subject‚Äôs face to scenic elements. His portraits, which he‚Äôs been referring to as ‚Äúcultural landscapes‚Äù for the past few years, are topographies of identity that involve replacing trees, rivers, and horizons with social markers. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs interesting to see the endless variants that each individual carries when we unpack who they are,‚Äù he shares with Colossal. More
articles.title: Plants, Motifs, and Cultural Symbols Are Superimposed onto Digital Portraits by Sam Rodriguez

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: One of the more accessible mediums, photography has long been an entry point for those relegated to the periphery of the art world, and a group exhibition on view now at the Denver Art Museum celebrates those who helped develop and define the genre as it grew throughout the 20th Century. Modern Women/Modern Vision features more than 100 shots by some of the era‚Äôs most influential photographers‚Äîthe list includes Berenice Abbott, Dorothea Lange, Diane Arbus, Eva Besny√∂, and Imogen Cunningham‚Äîshowcasing their distinct aesthetics, politics, and styles. More
articles.title: ‚ÄòModern Women/Modern Vision‚Äô Celebrates the 20th Century‚Äôs Most Influential Photographers

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: With long, elegant fingers and brawny limbs, the women that define Hanna Lee Joshi‚Äôs gouache and colored pencil works move through the unknown and indiscernible with strength. The Vancouver-based artist renders anonymous figures in motion, whether dancing together or gracefully gliding through water, on their search for greater autonomy and fulfillment unobscured by political, cultural, and social impositions. In comparison to her earlier series, Joshi‚Äôs most recent pieces rely more heavily on shades of blue and use more subtle gradients to contour a leg or elbow. More
articles.title: Graceful Women in Shades of Blue by Hanna Lee Joshi Express a Desire for Autonomy

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Evoking the textures and colors of his native Valencia, the sculptural furniture pieces by Spanish artist Nacho Carbonell are sensual interpretations of life in the Mediterranean. A bulbous, metal mesh canopy sprouts from a rugged pink seat, small wooden sticks comprise the sinuous patterns on a buffet, and a vibrant mosaic takes the form of a headphone-shaped lamp. Tactile and potentially functional, the objects reference the natural, sun-soaked environment of Carbonell‚Äôs childhood, in addition to art historical traditions like those of 15th Century painter Hieronymus Bosch and 20th Century Austrian sculptor Franz West. More
articles.title: Through Organic Sculptural Furniture, Artist Nacho Carbonell Channels the Sensual Details of the Mediterranean

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: From the misty waters of Benagil, Portugal, to Iceland‚Äôs cragged MuÃÅlagljuÃÅfur Canyon, the shots that comprise Vadim Sherbakov‚Äôs body of work capture the breadth and beauty of landscapes around the world. The photographer (previously) uses a combination of drones and cameras equipped with wide lenses to frame the natural colors and textures of Earth‚Äôs topographies: wind-battered snow ripples across the magical Baikal Lake, a hazy fog cloaks the rocky ravines of SigoÃàlduglijufur, and stars speckle the sky above the quaint Val di Funes. More
articles.title: Majestic Topographic Photos Frame the Rugged Textures and Serene Colors of Earth‚Äôs Landscapes

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Despite existing on separate continents thousands of miles apart, the Madeira brimstone and giant Patagonian bumblebee are experiencing similar hardships. The former, which inhabits the islands it inherits its name from, is dealing with an invasive species decimating the trees its caterpillars require pre-metamorphosis, while the latter has been struggling to survive in its native Chile after farmers introduced domesticated European bees to aid in crop pollination. Both species are in danger and are part of an ongoing exhibition at the American Museum of Natural History conveying what‚Äôs at stake if their species are lost entirely. More
articles.title: In ‚ÄòExtinct and Endangered,‚Äô Photographer Levon Biss Magnifies the Potential Loss of Insects Around the Globe

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: A follow-up to his wooden geometric figures, Mat Random designed a similarly stocky simian with a DIY twist. The architect and craftsman, who‚Äôs based in Buenos Aires, recently released a three-dimensional puzzle that once slotted together, forms a moveable ape-like creature. Made from 546 pieces that are laser cut from cardboard, the buildable figure has flexible joints and can be posed in various stances. ‚ÄúThe Simian‚Äù is available as a limited edition in Random‚Äôs shop, and be sure to check out his Behance for more of his playful creations. More
articles.title: A 546-Piece Puzzle Slots into a Hulking Simian with Moveable Limbs

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: A bright blue bodega, clustered wooden complexes, and a classic design emblazoned with a Swiss flag occupy the lush landscape of the Brooklyn Botanic Garden this summer. Eclectic in style, concept, and technique, the collection establishes dozens of tiny homes for avians across the 52-acre site as part of For the Birds, a group exhibition exploring the disastrous effects of the climate crisis on the feathered creatures‚Äîresearchers estimate that North American populations have been reduced by 29 percent, or 3 billion birds, since 1970. More
articles.title: For the Birds: 33 Artists and Designers Reimagine Avian Architecture at the Brooklyn Botanic Garden

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Following a two-year hiatus, Vivid Sydney (previously) returned this May with a spectacular display of light and color. The annual month-long festival brings an array of installations, sculptures, and projections to the Australian city, and this year‚Äôs iteration included Lighting the Sails, a vibrant series of works by Aboriginal Martu artists that illuminated the Sydney Opera House with kaleidoscopic patterns, and a color-blocked animation on Customs House by Ken Donne. More
articles.title: Radiant Installations and Projections Illuminate Sydney‚Äôs Architecture for an Annual Light Festival

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
For the better part of a decade, U.K.-born, Stockholm-based photographer Luke Stephenson has been fascinated by show birds, their impeccably groomed feathers, and undeniably unique personalities. Whether centering on a white-eyed Zosterop or confrontational Spereo Starling, his portraits are minimal with monochromatic backdrops that accentuate the distinct colors and patterns of each plume.
The ongoing series, titled An Incomplete Dictionary of Show Birds, originated with Stephenson wanting to photograph budgies but was intrigued by other species when he met some of his future subjects and their owners. More
articles.title: Minimal Portraits by Luke Stephenson Frame the Elegant Plumage of Show Birds

articles.author: Kate Mothes
articles.description: In the Gifu Prefecture of Japan, a nucleus of creativity blossomed in Kasahara Town, Tajimi City, more than a millennium ago. Known for its history of ceramic production, the region celebrates its distinctive heritage with a spring and autumn festival, a ceramics-themed park, and pottery shops that teach visitors the tradition. Among its newest attractions, set in a rolling green, the Mosaic Tile Museum Tajimi focuses on a more recent aspect of the ceramics industry. More
articles.title: An Astonishing Array of Ceramic Mosaic Tiles Comprise a Japanese Museum‚Äôs Historical Collection

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Swedish audiovisual artist and woodworker Love Hult√©n is known for his extravagant and unconventional sound installations that fall at the intersection of music, art, and design. Whether an homage to Nintendo, Pacman, or Simone Giertz‚Äôs chattering mouths, the custom synthesizers are elaborate electronic instruments with broad audio capabilities and often, a unique MIDI visualizer that responds in real-time: play the keyboard of ‚ÄúNES-SY37,‚Äù for example, and a rendering evocative of a vintage video game will appear on a tiny LCD screen. More
articles.title: Extravagant Sound Installations by Love Hult√©n Use Custom Synthesizers and Visualizers to Create Elaborate Audiovisual Mashups

articles.author: Gabrielle Lawrence
articles.description:
Softness is often mistaken for weakness, and simplicity for lack, but Chiron Duong‚Äôs 365 Days of Ao Dai series holds the history of this Vietnamese tradition in full texture.
According to Duong, ‚ÄúVietnamese Ao Dai is not only a kind of national costume but also contains a rich history, cultural traditions, aesthetic conceptions, national consciousness, and spirit of the Vietnamese people.‚Äù The garment‚Äôs capacity to ‚Äúcontain many memories‚Äù is most obviously captured by multi-bodied portraits, such as photos from days 183 and 208 that indicate unfolding stories. More
articles.title: An Ethereal Daily Portrait Series by Chiron Duong Captures the Vietnamese Tradition of Ao Dai

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Even in the wake of major weather events like the unprecedented flooding that closed Yellowstone National Park for the first time in decades last week, it can be difficult to grasp the magnitude of the climate crisis. The Tempestry Project has been striving to make such large-scale shifts more accessible and relatable through data-rich tapestries, which founders Asy Connelly and Emily McNeil discuss in a new interview supported by Colossal Members. More
articles.title: Interview: A Conversation with The Tempestry Project Delves Into the Importance of Knitting Tangible Records of Climate Data

articles.author: Sabina Graves
articles.description:
Netflix and Nickelodeon‚Äôs Rise of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Movie has released its first trailer ahead of its Netflix premiere this summer. Directed by Emmy winners Ant Ward and Andy Suriano, it features the turtles embarking on a continuation of their series when a visitor arrives from the future to warn‚Ä¶

articles.title: An Apocalyptic Threat Looms in the Rise of The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Movie Trailer

articles.description:
The Radiant Citadel is not a dungeon. It‚Äôs a way stop, a place for Dungeons & Dragons characters to rest on the road... specifically, roads to and from the various dimensional worlds of D&D. It‚Äôs a place where any player can find themselves, perhaps embarking on the 13 adventures found in the upcoming Journeys Through‚Ä¶

articles.author: Ed Cara
articles.description:
Scientists in California are asking for U.S. volunteers who live with cats to participate in a new research project. The¬†study will survey owners about their pet‚Äôs behaviors and their knowledge of training methods. The team‚Äôs larger goal is to help cats‚Äîespecially kittens‚Äîand humans better form healthy relationships‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: If You're Owned by a Cat, Scientists Want to Hear From You

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
The Lost Ark. Sankara Stones. The Holy Grail. A Crystal Skull. An Indiana Jones movie isn‚Äôt an Indiana Jones movie if the world‚Äôs most famous adventuring archeologist isn‚Äôt going after something tangible. This leads us to believe that in next year‚Äôs untitled fifth Indiana Jones film, Indy will be doing the same. But,‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: What Should Indiana Jones Go After in Indiana Jones 5?

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
A Georgia roadside attraction that became such a beacon for online conspiracy theorists it got The History Channel to take crackpot shots at it, is now devastated after an unknown person or persons reportedly blew up part of the structure Wednesday morning.
Read more...
articles.title: Somebody Blew Up America's Stonehenge

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
Apple announced a new security feature Wednesday designed to protect iPhone users from invasive spyware attacks. Dubbed ‚ÄúLockdown Mode,‚Äù the feature promises to ‚Äúharden‚Äù the security posture of your device, drawing a digital moat around its perimeter to protect against infiltration while also hobbling some of its‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Apple Debuts 'Lockdown Mode' to Protect iPhone Users From Mercenary Spyware Attacks

articles.author: Florence Ion
articles.description:
NFTs are trendy, and Nothing‚Äôs fan base seems to want nothing to do with them. The company that‚Äôs been recently buzzed about in Android circles for its heavily teased upcoming smartphone launch announced today that it‚Äôs shilling NFTs. They‚Äôre called Nothing Community Dots, and they‚Äôre there to entice you to ‚Äúconnect‚Äù‚Ä¶

articles.author: Artem Golub
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: Matthew Modine on Climate Justice

articles.description:
It‚Äôs going to be a long time until Stranger Things returns. As season four is currently being binged and talked about endlessly, we‚Äôre looking back on some of the best needle drops featured in the hit Netflix series.

articles.title: Stranger Things' 17 Best Season 4 Needle Drops

articles.author: David Nield
articles.description:
The number of products we‚Äôre buying online keeps going up and up, and that means you‚Äôre likely to have more and more packages coming to your address. When something you‚Äôve ordered doesn‚Äôt show up, that can be hugely frustrating‚Äîand potentially very expensive too. Here‚Äôs what to do should that worst case scenario‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: What You Should Do if One of Your Packages Goes Missing

articles.author: Lauren Leffer
articles.description:
The only thing protecting the state of Utah from toxic, arsenic-filled dust storms is the expanse of saline water known as the Great Salt Lake. But bad news: The lake is rapidly drying up. It‚Äôs currently sitting at its lowest recorded water level ever, which was first recorded on Sunday.

Read more...
articles.title: Utah's Great Salt Lake Dwindles to New Record Low

articles.author: Shoshana Wodinsky
articles.description:
The Supreme Court‚Äôs move to overturn Roe v. Wade has left abortion-seekers across the U.S. scrambling to find access to medical care online, only to find themselves awash in a sea of search results and ads for clinics offering anything but. Now, the biggest search engine out there is making it slightly (and I do mean‚Ä¶
Read more...

articles.description:
Attention Amazon Prime members: ordering lunch just got easier. The company that brings you all your favorite products has announced that Prime members are eligible for a free, one year membership to GrubHub+ starting today.

articles.title: Amazon Prime Members Now Have Access to an Exclusive GrubHub Deal

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Don‚Äôt worry: next up for the Duffer Brothers, the creators of Stranger Things, is Stranger Things 5. After Stranger Things 4 crossed a billion hours watched for Netflix, the streamer is, obviously, going to want that as soon as possible. So writing starts soon. But Netflix wants to stay in business with the brothers‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: A Stranger Things Play and New Death Note Are Among the Duffer Brothers' Upcoming Projects

articles.author: Angely Mercado
articles.description:
A scorching summer continues in the U.S. as a massive heat dome is slated to affect Southwestern and Central U.S. states. Areas in the region will experience consecutive days of temperatures in the high 90s and low 100s Fahrenheit.
Read more...
articles.title: A Heat Dome Is Bringing Dangerous Temperatures to the Southwest

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
While working out of a hotel room in Italy, astronaut Thomas Reiter commanded a four-wheeled robot to pick up rocks from the surface of an active volcano on the Sicilian east coast, and he did so while role-playing as though he were in orbit around the Moon. 

Read more...
articles.title: Rover Gathers Rocks From Active Volcano During Simulated Moon Mission

articles.author: Swara Salih
articles.description:
Last we left Ms. Marvel‚Äôs burgeoning young hero, Kamala Khan (Iman Vellani), she found herself transported back in time to Partition-era India at a train station after the leader of the Clandestine, Najma (Nimra Bucha) accidentally struck her family bangle. Has the bangle actually sent Kamala back in time? What will‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Ms. Marvel Travels to the Past to Make the Present More Powerful

articles.author: Andrew Liszewski
articles.description:
It‚Äôs safe to assume that Apple is going to release a second version of its excellent AirPods Max wireless headphones at some point, but we‚Äôre hoping that the company will include a better carrying case the second time around. Our prayers might be answered, as a new patent awarded to Apple may provide a sneak peek at‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Apple Just Patented a Better AirPods Max Case

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
‚ÄúThe skies are strange,‚Äù a man named Sadoc Burrows says in a brand-new teaser for Prime Video‚Äôs upcoming show The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power. What follows is some kind of object soaring above Middle-earth like a rocket. The elves see it. The dwarves see it. The ents see it. Until finally, it lands, almost‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: In the New Lord of the Rings: Rings of Power Teaser, Something's Falling From the Sky

articles.description:
Pressure‚Äôs mounting to throw TikTok back into the regulatory spotlight, this time from a bipartisan pair of U.S. senators on the Senate Intelligence Committee.

articles.title: Senate Intelligence Committee Leaders Warner and Rubio Call on FTC to Investigate TikTok

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
E-cig company Juul has had a black cloud above its head thanks to federal regulators‚Äô efforts to squash the brand, but recent court and agency decisions might mean executive efforts to hamper vape companies could potentially go up in smoke.
Read more...
articles.title: You Can Buy Juul Again‚Ä¶for Now

articles.author: Rob Bricken
articles.description:
It seems hard to imagine now, but there was almost a full decade when Star Wars toys didn‚Äôt exist. After the 1986 end of the Kenner action figure line, it took until 1995 for Hasbro to bring toys back to shelves with the title ‚ÄúPower of the Force,‚Äù and the results were‚Ä¶ terrible. Just terrible. So, in order to better‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Remembering the Godawful Star Wars Action Figures of Yesteryear

articles.author: Lauren Leffer
articles.description:
Microsoft announced its nearly $69 billion purchase of massive gaming company, Activision Blizzard in January. But the road to acquisition hasn‚Äôt been smooth for the two companies, and the deal isn‚Äôt sealed yet.

Read more...
articles.title: UK Antitrust Investigation Is Latest Microsoft-Activision Acquisition Speedbump

articles.author: Rob Bricken
articles.description:
It‚Äôs no spoiler to say that Eddie Munson (Joseph Quinn) is just as talented at playing the electric guitar as he was at being a Dungeon Master. But to learn the truth behind the most badass moment in Stranger Things‚Äô fourth season finale and you somehow haven‚Äôt watched it yet, well, you know what that means.

Read more...
articles.title: Stranger Things Got Eddie a Little Help With His Outrageously Rad Guitar Solo in the Finale

articles.author: Molly Taft
articles.description:
I hesitated to come out. It was 2020 when I finally, finally started to see my queerness through the clouds. The world was burning (still is), suffering through a global pandemic (still is), reeling from a societal upheaval (still is), and American fascism was gaining strength at a terrifying speed (I repeat myself).‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Pride at the End of the World

articles.author: Matt Novak
articles.description:
A verified GoFundMe fundraiser for a 2-year-old boy who lost both of his parents to gun violence on Monday has raised over $1.8 million and counting, as of Wednesday morning. The boy‚Äôs parents were gunned down at a Fourth of July parade in Highland Park, Illinois, which saw seven people murdered and dozens injured.

Read more...
articles.title: GoFundMe for Boy Who Lost Both Parents in Fourth of July Shooting Raises $1.8 Million

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Flashback to May 4, 2020. That was the day the official Star Wars website announced that recent Oscar winner Taika Waititi was going to make a Star Wars movie, one he‚Äôd direct and co-write along with Oscar nominee Krysty Wilson-Cairns. A few months after that, Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy reconfirmed Waititi‚Äôs‚Ä¶
Read more...
articles.title: Are You as Confused About Taika Waititi's Star Wars Movie as We Are?

articles.author: James Whitbrook
